questions.text: Which of the following animal categories are present on the farm?
Are there, besides the pigs, any other farm animals present on your farm?
What other farm animal(s) is (are) present on your farm?
How many years of experience in keeping pigs does the person in charge have?
What is the number of people (full-time or part-time) that are taking care of the pigs?
How old (in years) is the oldest building in which pigs are being kept?
questions.help: If the building was renovated, give the age before the renovation.

questions.text: How old (in years) is the newest building in which pigs are being kept?
questions.help: If the building was renovated, give the age before the renovation.

categories.name: Purchase of Breeding Pigs, Weaned Piglets and Semen

questions.text: Are breeding pigs (sows/gilts/boars) purchased?
Are the breeding pigs (during the past 2 years) always bought from the same supplier?
Whenever breeding pigs are bought from another farm, is the supplier's health status known before purchase?
questions.help: A herd with a known health status is a herd from which it is known if it is free from specific diseases (e.g., scabies, PRRS) or not.

options.label: Yes, the supplier's health status is higher than my own status
Yes, the supplier's health status is equal to my own status
Yes, the supplier's health status is lower than my own, but I take precautious measures
Yes, the supplier's health status is lower than my own and no precautious measures are taken

questions.text: Is it verified (e.g. written document or other statements) whether the transport vehicle that brings the breeding pigs to the farm is cleaned and disinfected before loading?
questions.help: If the transport vehicle looks visually clean but the transporter cannot provide evidence of the cleaning and disinfection, select 'I don't know'.

questions.text: How many times per year are breeding pigs delivered to your farm?
Are all new breeding pigs quarantined in an area separate from the rest of the herd?
questions.help: The quarantine area can be in the same building, but it should be completely separate (no physical contact) from the rest of the animals.

questions.text: Is strict all-in management practised in the quarantine area?
questions.help: All-in: all the animals that have to be quarantined are put into the quarantine area at the same moment. It's crucial that no new animals are introduced before it is emptied.

questions.text: What is the minimum duration (in days) of the quarantine period that you applied in the last year?
Is there a separate hygiene lock for the quarantine area?
questions.help: A hygiene lock is a facility, where among others, you can change into specific clothes/boots and clean/disinfect your hands.

questions.text: Are piglets purchased?
Are the piglets (during the past 2 years) always bought from the same supplier?
Whenever piglets are bought from another farm, is the supplier's health status known before purchase?

options.label: Yes, the supplier's health status is higher than my own status
Yes, the supplier's health status is equal to my own status
Yes, lower but I take precautious measures
Yes, lower and no precautious measures

questions.text: Is it verified whether the transport vehicle that brings the piglets is cleaned and disinfected before loading?
How many times per year are piglets delivered to your farm?
Does breeding occur naturally or artificially?
Which boars are used for natural breeding?

options.label: Own boars that remain on the farm
Own boars that are housed on different farm(s)
Breeding boars that are used on different farms

questions.text: Whenever semen is purchased from a farm/boar station, is the supplier's health status known before purchase?

options.label: Yes, supplier's health status is higher than mine
Yes, equal to my own status
Yes, lower but I take precautions

categories.name: Transport of Animals, Removal of Deadstock and Manure

questions.text: Is the establishment physically divided into a clean and dirty area?
questions.help: The clean area is where only farm animals, authorized persons after hygiene measures, and farm-specific materials are allowed. The dirty area includes all other parts with visitor/vehicle access.

questions.text: Are slaughter pigs transported from your farm to the slaughterhouse?
Is the transport vehicle for the slaughter pigs empty before loading?
Is it verified whether the transport vehicle for slaughter pigs is cleaned and disinfected before loading?
Are sows transported from your farm either to other farms or to the slaughterhouse?
Is the transport vehicle for the sows empty before loading?
Is it verified whether the transport vehicle for sows is cleaned and disinfected before loading?
Are piglets transported from your farm to other farms (e.g. to a finisher site)?
Is the transport vehicle for the piglets empty before loading?
Is it verified whether the transport vehicle for piglets is cleaned and disinfected before loading?
Does the driver have access to the animal holding areas and/or is direct contact with the animals possible when loading?

options.label: Farmer and/or farm personnel is the driver (own transport)

questions.text: Does the driver receive and wear farm-specific clothing and shoes?

options.label: The driver brings his/her own cleaned and disinfected clothing and shoes
The driver stays inside the transport vehicle

questions.text: Are the pigs loaded from a separate loading area or directly from the pens/central corridor?
questions.help: The separate loading area is a physically separated location where the animals are brought before/during loading.

questions.text: Are pigs ever returned to the pens after they were in the transport vehicle?
Is manure transported and disposed of through the dirty access road?
Are farm-specific hoses for the removal of manure from the manure pit available?
questions.help: Hoses for manure removal that always stay at the farm.

questions.text: Is there a dedicated deadstock storage space, physically separated from the animal facilities?

options.label: Yes, but it is not physically separated from the live animals
Not relevant, deadstock is immediately processed

questions.text: Is the deadstock storage space located in the dirty area of the farm?
Is the deadstock storage space enclosed and well maintained to prevent vermin, pets or wild animals from accessing?
Is the deadstock storage cooled?
Is the deadstock storage space cleaned and disinfected after each use?
What happens with deadstock?
questions.help: Composting is natural decomposition. Burying might be prohibited in your country.

options.label: Deadstock is stored and collected by a rendering company

questions.text: Is deadstock composted in a closed system?

options.label: Yes, dead animals are composted inside a building that can be completely closed
Yes, dead animals are composted outside, enclosed with e.g. plastic

questions.text: How are dead animals buried/burned?
questions.help: Buried in appropriate soil: deep burial in pits away from groundwater source.

options.label: Dead animals are burned in an approved incinerator on the farm
Dead animals are buried in the appropriate soil on the farm

questions.text: Can deadstock be collected by the rendering company without them entering the premises of the farm?
questions.help: E.g. from the public road

questions.text: Does the farmer/farmworker change footwear when entering the deadstock area?
Is deadstock manipulated with single-use gloves, or are hands cleaned and disinfected after manipulation?
What type of feed is used on the farm?
questions.help: Swill feeding might be prohibited in your country.

questions.text: Does animal feed originate from a feeding company meeting specific hygienic requirements?
questions.help: E.g. Salmonella-free, heat treatment such as pelletizing

questions.text: Can the feeding company fill up the feed silos/storage without entering the clean area?
Does the feed supplier have access to the animal holding areas where direct contact with the pigs is possible?
Is the water delivery system (incl. a water header tank) covered at all times?
How frequently is a bacteriological analysis of the drinking water performed?

options.label: Less frequent than every two years
Never, I have a municipal water supply

questions.text: At which location are the water samples for the bacteriological analyses taken?

options.label: Both at the source and the last drinker (farthest away from the source)
Other (e.g. drinker at the beginning of the line)

questions.text: Is a specific and well-functioning pass-through for materials entering the buildings used?
questions.help: E.g. a UV cabinet for utensils and tools. Materials can be mobile phones, documents, pens, diagnostic tools, etc.

questions.text: Is there any equipment (small or large) shared with other farms that enter your farm and/or has contact with your pigs?
Are specific measures taken for the introduction of equipment from other farms?
questions.help: E.g. cleaning and disinfection, quarantine period at a specific location.

questions.text: Does the farm follow a written biosecurity plan?
questions.help: Should contain: critical aspects/risks, prioritization of biosecurity implementation, and at least annual revisions.

questions.text: Did the farmer and/or farmworkers receive training on biosecurity in pig production in the last five years?
questions.help: Training can be a diploma, e-learning, workshops, or webinars. Can also be given by internal personnel with certified training.

options.label: Both have received training on biosecurity
Only one of them has received training on biosecurity
Neither of them has received training on biosecurity

questions.text: Are visitors obliged to notify and record their presence before entering the animal facilities?
questions.help: E.g. closed gate requiring call/bell, obligation to sign register book.

questions.text: Is there a hygiene lock available that is always used by visitors when they enter the animal facilities?
questions.help: A hygiene lock is a room where you can change into farm-specific clothes/footwear and wash/disinfect hands.

options.label: There is a hygiene lock present, but it is not always used

questions.text: Are all animal facilities only accessible for visitors through a hygiene lock?
questions.help: No alternative ways to enter - must always go through the hygiene lock.

questions.text: Is there a strict separation between the clean and the dirty area of the hygiene lock?
questions.help: E.g. by a physical barrier (wooden plank/bench) or a walkthrough shower. Dirty area is where people enter/store clothes; clean area is where they put on farm-specific clothing.

questions.text: Is there a shower facility and is it always used by visitors/personnel before they enter the animal facilities?

options.label: Only for visitors, not for personnel
There is a shower facility, but it is not always used

questions.text: Before being allowed to enter the farm, do visitors and farmworkers have to...?

rows.text: wear available farm-specific clothes/bring clean clothes (if not available)
wear available farm-specific footwear/bring clean and disinfected footwear (if not available)

questions.text: Are there farmworkers who have contact with pigs other than those on the establishment?
questions.help: Pigs at home, on other farms, wild boars, hunting, agricultural shows, etc.

questions.text: Is the outside of the farm buildings (around the walls) paved and clean (removal of weeds, waste, ...) so that there are no hiding places for vermin?
Is a pest control programme in place on the farm?

options.label: A professional pest control company is hired periodically
The farm has its own periodical pest control programme
Pest control is performed only if an infestation/overpopulation is noticed (e.g. via rodent traps)
There is no pest control programme

questions.text: Do pets or wild animals have access to the animal facilities (incl. the storage for feed and bedding material)?
Do birds have access to the animal facilities (incl. the storage for feed and bedding material)?
Are grids placed on all air in- and outlets?
questions.help: Grids that are small enough to keep rodents and small birds out.

questions.text: Is the farm located in an area with a high or a low density of pigs?
questions.help: A region with high density has >300 pigs/kmÂ² at municipality level. If there are multiple pig farms within 3 km radius, you're likely in high-density area.

questions.text: Are there any other pig farms within a 500-metre radius (0.3 miles) of your farm?
Is manure from other pig farms being spread on farmlands within a 500-metre radius (0.3 miles) of your farm?
Do transport vehicles carrying animals from other farms often (minimum once a day) pass on a road less than 100-metre (328 feet) from your farm?
questions.help: E.g. due to location of slaughterhouse in neighbourhood.

questions.text: Have wild boars (or their traces) been spotted within a 10-kilometre radius (6.2 miles) of your establishment?
Is the farm enclosed by wild-boar-proof fences?
questions.help: A wild-boar-proof fence is a double row of fencing made from metal net/wire with minimum height of 1.5m or a single solid fence made from metal, masonry, or other solid material with minimum height of 1.5m.

questions.text: Are the fences inspected on a regular basis (at least monthly) to identify breaches and repaired if needed?
Is there a treatment plan on the farm that is evaluated on an annual basis by a veterinarian/health advisor?
questions.help: Health advisor: any person who comes to the farm to help improve health (e.g. nutritionist, consultant).

questions.text: Is a regular (at least once a year) evaluation made of the disease status of the farm (e.g. serology, trends in slaughterhouse findings, etc.) in consultation with a veterinarian/health advisor?
Are runt pigs (stay-behinds e.g. due to unclear causes) and/or diseased pigs isolated from the healthy ones or is a strict euthanasia policy used?

options.label: Runt pigs are always isolated from the healthy animals
Runt pigs are sometimes isolated from the healthy animals
Runt pigs are not isolated, they always remain within their group
There is a strict euthanasia policy, so there are no/barely any runt pigs

questions.text: What happens with the runt pigs after recovery?

options.label: They are put back into their original group
They are relocated to a younger age group
They are kept isolated from the other animals until they leave the farm

questions.text: Are diseased pigs consistently handled/visited after the healthy ones?

categories.name: Farrowing and Suckling Period
categories.description: Where sows and after farrowing their suckling piglets are housed together

questions.text: Are the sows washed before they are moved into the farrowing unit?
Are suckling piglets systematically transferred between sows (i.e. cross-fostering)?
Does cross-fostering of suckling piglets between different sows occur once or multiple times per lactation?
When does cross-fostering occur?
How many times are the piglets routinely taken by hand (e.g. vaccination, castration, grinding of teeth, tail docking, ear tagging) between birth and weaning?
questions.help: Some manipulations might be prohibited in your country. If multiple manipulations occur at same moment, count as one occasion.

questions.text: Are materials/tools for treatment (e.g. castration blade, tail-docker, ear-tagger, injection needles) cleaned and disinfected or replaced between each litter?

options.label: Only some of the materials/tools are cleaned and disinfected or replaced

questions.text: When castrating, are the castration blades/needles disinfected or replaced between different piglets?

options.label: The blades/needles are disinfected or replaced after each piglet
The blades/needles are disinfected/replaced after several piglets or different blades/needles per pen are used
The blades/needles are not disinfected or replaced until blunt

categories.name: Nursery Unit
categories.description: Where all weaned piglets are housed together

questions.text: Is strict all-in management practised in each compartment of the nursery unit?
questions.help: All-in: animals moved to the same nursery unit all at once and no new animals introduced before it is emptied.

questions.text: Are older piglets (from a different farrowing group) sometimes mixed with younger piglets?
What is the maximal stocking density of a pen in the nursery unit?
Is the nursery unit physically separated (i.e. no direct contact possible) from the other pig units?
questions.help: No other animal groups present in the same building/area.

questions.text: Is there a separate hygiene lock for the nursery unit?
questions.help: A hygiene lock is a facility where you can change into specific clothes/boots and clean/disinfect hands.

categories.name: Finishing Unit
categories.description: Where all slaughter pigs are housed together

questions.text: Is strict all-in management practiced in each compartment of the finishing unit?
questions.help: All-in: animals moved to same finishing unit all at once and no new animals introduced before emptied.

questions.text: Are different age groups strictly separated into different (physically separated) compartments/areas?
Are older slaughter pigs sometimes mixed with younger pigs?
What is the maximal pig density of a pen in the finishing unit?
questions.help: Regular slaughter pigs: 90-115 kg live weight. Heavy slaughter pigs: >115 kg.

options.label: 1 or more mÂ² per slaughter pig (1.50 mÂ² or more per heavy slaughter pig)
0.70 to 0.99 mÂ² per slaughter pig (1.10 to 1.49 mÂ² per heavy)
0.60 to 0.69 mÂ² per slaughter pig (0.80 to 1.09 mÂ² per heavy)
Less than 0.60 mÂ² per slaughter pig (less than 0.80 mÂ² per heavy)

categories.name: Measures Between Compartments, Working Lines and Equipment Use

questions.text: Are different compartments/age groups present on the establishment?
Between different compartments/age groups, are the following actions performed?
questions.help: Compartment: a physically defined unit where one group of pigs is kept.

rows.text: Change into specific clothes per compartment/age group
Change into specific footwear per compartment/age group
Wash hands/change gloves per compartment/age group

questions.text: Are either disinfection baths and/or boot washers used between different compartments/units?
Which working sequence is used in normal circumstances?
Is the equipment that is needed for a specific animal category placed according to the working lines to avoid use in other age categories?
Are clearly recognizable (e.g. by colors) and separate materials/tools used for each unit or age group?
questions.help: For all units: farrowing crates, nursery unit and finishing unit.

questions.text: Are the pig sorting/driving panels easy to clean (e.g. plastic) and are they regularly cleaned and disinfected?
questions.help: Regularly: after every use or at least after every production cycle during sanitary break.

options.label: Yes, the panels are easy to clean and are regularly cleaned and disinfected
The panels are easy to clean but are not regularly cleaned and disinfected
The panels are not easy to clean (e.g. wood) but are regularly cleaned and disinfected
No, the panels are not easy to clean and are not regularly cleaned and disinfected

questions.text: Are specific injection syringes and needles used for each age group?
questions.help: For all units: farrowing crates, nursery unit and finishing unit.

options.label: Both syringes and needles are specific for each age group
Only the needles are specific for the age group

questions.text: After how many pigs are the injection needles changed?
questions.help: For all units. If this differs per compartment, indicate worst-case scenario.

questions.text: Are the pens/compartments cleaned after each production cycle?
questions.help: For all units: farrowing crates, nursery unit and finishing unit.

options.label: All pens/compartments are cleaned after each production cycle
Only some of the pens/compartments are cleaned after each production cycle
The pens/compartments are cleaned after every couple of production cycles

questions.text: Are the pens/compartments soaked with water before the start of the cleaning?

options.label: Never, I only practise dry cleaning

questions.text: Is detergent/soap added to the water during cleaning?
Are the pens/compartments disinfected after each production cycle?
questions.help: For all units: farrowing crates, nursery unit and finishing unit.

options.label: All pens/compartments are disinfected after each production cycle
Only some of the pens/compartments are disinfected after each production cycle
The pens/compartments are disinfected after every couple of production cycles

questions.text: Are the animal facilities fully dried before new pigs enter?
Is the efficacy of cleaning and disinfection checked (e.g. hygienogram, ATP-metry, swabs)?
questions.help: A hygienogram is a quantification of the bacterial status of the environment with a contact plate.

questions.text: Are the corridors and the loading area cleaned and disinfected after the pigs are moved?

options.label: Not cleaned nor disinfected after use

questions.text: Is equipment (e.g. sorting/driving panels, spades) cleaned and disinfected after their use?
Are the feeding systems (feed lines, troughs) cleaned and disinfected after each production cycle?

options.label: Cleaned and disinfected after each production cycle
Only cleaned after each production cycle
Cleaned but not after each production cycle (only occasionally)

questions.text: Is the feed silo/storage cleaned (and disinfected) on the inside?

options.label: Less than once every two years

questions.text: Is the drinking water system cleaned and disinfected on the inside between production cycles?
questions.help: This excludes the use of continuous low doses of disinfectant during production cycles.

options.label: Less than once every two years
